title: The Real Problem with Honor and Season Rewards
body:
i started the game last year, finished the season as a silver player.  This year I got to gold only to discover that I would be ineligible for the rewards.

I think the biggest frustration isn’t with the rules and boundaries that players have violated; it’s with the messaging and transparency. It would have been a lot easier to avoid potential violations if I had been aware of all the penalties and how to accumulate them.

It felt like I was unaware of consequences until I had accumulated the penalties and from there, the potential for recovery was non-existent.

***Context for my specific reason for being banned, as the comments below seem to assume it was for bigotry***

I was one checkpoint away when the season ended. I'm Honor 1.3 currently. I think I may still be doomed though because I was banned in August for acquiring too many chat restrictions. I never displayed bigotry in-game chat, mostly excessive typing and flaming feeders, some afk'ing at spawn when the team wouldn't ff at 3/25 score lines.  (have since reformed, limited typing)

Jungle in Silver can be so tilting.... sad! Had to malzahar my way out.

Unless you were suspended, they've extended the date to achieve honor 2 until February. 4 months is a substantial amount of time to gain honor 2 back.
